Posts.Content: Little Susan Employers have a legal obligation where cancer is concerned under the Equality Act 2010 and have to make reasonable adjustmentsÂ to help you continue your working life if they do not comply with this , there is potentially disability discrimination against you. I went back to work in July 2013 following surgery, seven months of chemo and three weeks of rads, It took me a year of phased return to get back to full time hours and the fatigue is still a major problem for me. I found the Macmillan booklet Work and Cancer invaluable- it stipulates how employers must make reasonable adjustments for us to return to some normality. I hope all works out well for you. Mel

Posts.Content: Am loving the positivity on this site- my mantra from the beginning of this journey was" That was then, this is now". and its held me in good stead. No one said it was going to be easy but we're getting there,
